Blogo Utils¶

class blogo_utils.BlogoUtils¶

A class of useful helper functions to be used when programming with Blender

add_blend_file(coll_name, link=True)¶

Load a .blend file and put in the current scene

Parameters

  • filepath – The name of the file to load

  • coll_name – The collection name to add it to

  • link – If true then the file is only linked, otherwise it is appended

add_camera(from_location, central_locations, capture_locations=None, angle=None, roll=0)¶

Place a camera at a particular location and point it at another location

Parameters

  • from_location – The location of the camera

  • central_locations – A list of locations to point the camera towards the middle of

  • capture_locations – A list of locations that should be in frame (not yet implemented)

  • angle – The angle in radians over which the camera should capture

  • roll – The angle in radians to roll the camera round

add_light(location, point_at, size, energy, type, shape, use_shadow)¶

Add a light to a scene

Parameters

  • name –

  • location –

  • point_at –

  • size –

  • energy –

  • type –

  • shape –

  • use_shadow –

Returns

add_light_area(location=(0, 0, 3218.68), size=10000, energy=1210000000.0, shape='SQUARE')¶

Add a light in the form of a plane

Parameters

  • name –

  • location –

  • size –

  • energy –

  • shape –

Returns

add_light_bulb(location=(0, 0, 3218.68), angle=120, energy=100)¶

Add a spot light to a scene

Parameters

  • name –

  • location –

  • angle –

  • energy –

Returns

add_locations(location2, mul2=1, mul1=1)¶

Add two locations or vectors together

add_texture(textureFile, alpha=1.0, unwrap=False, smart_project=False, texture_scale=None)¶

Add texture to an object

angle_between(b)¶

Return the angle between two vectors

boolean_op(op, b_list)¶

Perform either union, intersection or difference between two objects or lists of objects

Parameters

  • a_list – Either a blender object, or a list of blender objects

  • op – The operation to perform, one of ‘DIFFERENCE’, ‘UNION’ or ‘INTERSECTION’

  • b_list – Either a blender object, or a list of blender objects

Returns

clear_info()¶

Clear all lines from the info screen

copy_object(location, relative_location=True, copy_mesh=True)¶

Copy an object and insert it into a new location

create_object(vertices, faces)¶

Create an object from a list vertices and faces

cross_product(b)¶

Return the cross product of two vectors

dot_product(b)¶

Return the dot product of two vectors

draw_mesh(vertices, faces, textureFile, alpha=1.0, unwrap=False, smart_project=False, texture_scale=None)¶

Create an object from the given lists of vertices and faces and with the given texture

draw_plane_from_func(func, pts, closed_x=False, closed_y=False, texture=None, **kwargs)¶

Draw an object defined by a function giving the position of either point in the grid of the plane.

The function given should be of the form: def my_func(x, y, rx, ry, **kwargs):

where x, y is the current position in the plane, and rx, ry is the position in the plane from 0 to 1

Parameters

  • name – The name the new object will have

  • func – A function to pass each point in the plane to

  • pts – A tuple giving either (x_max, y_max) or (x_min, y_min, x_max, y_max). x_min and y_min default to 0

  • closed_x – If True then the in the x direction 0 will be connected to max_x (default False)

  • closed_y – If True then the in the y direction 0 will be connected to max_y (default False)

  • texture – The texture to draw on the plane

  • kwargs – User data to pass on to func

get_projected_angle(vec_on_plane, plane_normal)¶

Get the angle between the component of vector on a plane and a vector on that plane

hide_cameras_and_lights()¶

Stop the renderer from showing camera and light objects, but still show their light

is_sequence()¶

Tell whether a variable is a sequence, i.e. a list or tuple

join_objects()¶

Join multiple objects together

line_length()¶

Return the length of a line

list_missing(partial_list)¶

Return the items that are in full_list, but not in partial_list

e.g. list_missing((1, 2, 3, 4), (1, 3, 5)) ==> (2, 4)

Parameters

  • full_list – The full list of items

  • partial_list – full_list with some items missing

Returns

The difference between the lists

mode_set()¶

Set the given mode, e.g. “OBJECT” or “EDIT”

norm()¶

Return the norm of the vector

normalize()¶

Normalise a vector

normalize_angle()¶

Return an angle between 0 and 360 giving the same heading as angle

object_counter()¶

Return a unique number

project_onto_plane(normal)¶

Project a vector onto a plane defined by a normal to that plane

rotate_axis(vec, angle)¶

Rotate a vector around an axis by an angle in degrees

rotation_matrix(theta)¶

Return the rotation matrix associated with counterclockwise rotation about the given axis by theta radians.

select_object(mode='EDIT')¶

Select a single object and move into a new mode

select_objects()¶

Select all objects

show_objects()¶

Move to the screen showing rendered objects

smart_project_object()¶

Run smart project for an object

start_fresh()¶

Delete everything, so that we can start again

take_picture(from_location, central_locations, capture_locations=None, angle=None, roll=0)¶

Place a camera at a particular location, point it at another location and save that picture to disk.

Parameters

  • file – The name of the file to save to.

  • from_location – The location of the camera

  • central_locations – A list of locations to point the camera towards the middle of

  • capture_locations – A list of locations that should be in frame (not yet implemented)

  • angle – The angle in radians over which the camera should capture

  • roll – The angle in radians to roll the camera round

unit_vector()¶

Returns the unit vector of a vector

unselect_object(prev_mode=None)¶

Unselect an object

unselect_objects()¶

Unselect all objects

unwrap_object()¶

Run UV unwrap for an object
